fields.description:
My teams are conducting a trial of Portfolio, but we are encountering the following roadblock:

We would like to do some retroactive reporting, e.g. 2015 or YTD 2016 based on story points completed. After importing issues from JIRA and mapping our closed issues to the appropriate themes, we do get percentages in the Expected column, but the Actual column is empty.

 !image-2016-01-13-12-03-44-186.png|thumbnail! 

When viewing the backlog, all of the closed issues are "not yet scheduled."

 !image-2016-01-13-12-05-13-825.png|thumbnail! 

It appears that a "full workload is assigned" when attempting to assign to any developer.

 !image-2016-01-13-12-06-29-580.png|thumbnail! 

I suspect that the inability to schedule these issues is our problem. Does Portfolio only begin reporting Actual completed work once it sees the issues transition to closed? If we want to capture the work we have already completed in 2016 toward Actual percentages, how do we do that?
fields.summary: Issues that were already closed when imported are not reflected in Actual totals

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1262].
  {panel}

We are working with offshore team.
Team doesn't work with the same rhythm across the world. 

We would like to be able the set the appropriate working hours by teams.
By default the can use the working our of the Plan, but if needed it chould be very helpful to by more accurate by teams.
fields.summary: Working hours by teams

fields.description:
When trying to import a project into Portfolio an _unexpected exception_ is raised [1]

This issue is raised by the following steps:

# Go to Portfolio Button
# Select _Create Plan_
# Select _Live plan_
# Choose 
## Board or
## Project or
## Filter
# Click _Next_ Button

*Result:*  Exception will be raised.

*Additional Info:* I have also created a completely new JIRA scrum project with only default issue types. In this test case the unknown exception is also raised.

[1]

fields.summary: Importing a project with Live plan raises unknown exception
Add Epic Due Date in JIRA Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1259].
  {panel}

*Problem*
I open my Portfolio Live Plan and create a new story under an epic. I commit these changes, and the issue is created in JIRA.
When I look at this issue in JIRA there is no connection to the epic under which it was created.

*Expected behaviour*
When creating stories under an Epic in the Live View planner, that epic should be set as the epic link on the newly created issue after commiting.
fields.summary: Tasks created in Live plan under a Epic is not connected to that Epic in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1258].
  {panel}

I have an epic with a time estimate of aggregated hours from stories, and also have some hours registered on the epic itself. Attemting to change the hours on the epic itself from Live Plan works fine, but attempting to delete/reset the value causes a crash. See the error log below, and a video describing the steps here:
http://share.skaar.io/0b1q1j3h1y1I

fields.summary: Live Plan commit crash when removing time value on issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1257].
  {panel}

Just got beta access to Portfolio 2 in our cloud instance, and I'm experiencing av bug creating av Live Plan based on two of our kanban boards.

Look at this video:
http://share.skaar.io/3j353Z3Q192L

- When I create a plan with both of the boards, I'm logged out of JIRA after entering the two teams capacity and clicking 'next'.
- Creating a plan with only one of the boards works without the same error (tested with both boards)

Some details about the boards:
- DM4 board:
-- Kanban board with filter: _project = DM4 ORDER BY Rank ASC_
- Saigon board
-- kanban board with filter: _labels = Saigon_
-- Can contains issues across multiple projects, but as of now only has issues from 1 project

Our cloud instance is kulturit.atlassian.net
fields.summary: Getting logged out creating a Live Plan in Cloud Instance

fields.summary: IndexOutOfBoundsException - error when i try to show another board in my live plan
Team sharing or reusing already defined teams
Capture the pre-plan estimate of backlog items in Portfolio
Allow setting estimates on structured epics and initiatives

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1252].
  {panel}

I didnt see this yet...

I would like/need the ability to either copy a plan to a new plan, or export and re-import
it into a new plan.   

I dont need to copy all the baggage, if that makes it easier to implement.

Even for starters if you could copy
   - teams
   - releases
   - initiatives 
   - config data
   - epics

in that order, so if you didnt get to epics, I'd still hug you.  I can reimport the issues.


If you went the route of importing, then if you could import from the format of the export, that would be great.
fields.summary: Ability to Copy a Plan to a new Plan
Allow for the import of Issue Links
Customize Sprint Name

fields.description:
Problem:
When a user creates and links backlog items from Portfolio to JIRA, the Create Issue dialog of JIRA pops up when there are required fields. However, not all required fields display initially. Instead, clicking Create produces a required field error and adds the field to the dialog. 

Expected behaviour:
The dialog should present ALL required fields instead of forcing an error before presenting all fields.
fields.summary: When creating and linking issues, the create dialog does not present all required fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1248].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
When a user creates and links backlog items from Portfolio to JIRA, the _Create Issue_ dialog of JIRA pops up when there are required fields that have defined default values.

*Expected behaviour:*
The dialog should not pop up in this scenario since all required fields can be pre-populated with the default values and hence there is no need to show the dialog
fields.summary: When creating and linking backlog items to JIRA, the create issue dialog pops up even though mandatory fields have defined default values
zzzzzzzzzz
zzzz

fields.description:
When there are _Agile Boards_ wich have an invalid _Estimation Statistic_ configured, opening the board selection drop-down in the first step of the Live Plan creation wizard results in the error shown below.

*Workaround:*
Identify the problematic board and configure a valid estimation statistic. This can be done via _Boards > Manage boards_ and checking the _Estimation Statistic_ by selecting _Configure_ from the board's _..._ menu and opening the section _Estimation_. Once all boards are set to a valid estimation statistic, the error will no longer occur.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1222].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When JIRA Portfolio creates a plan export, it produces a UTF-8 encoded file. This is the expected behaviour. Subsequently importing this file uses the System File Encoding. This introduces a problem with some characters in various encodings as the characters become corrupt. 


h3. Environment
JIRA 6.4.12, 
JIRA Portfolio 1.10.4


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a JIRA environment up to use: {{-Dfile.encoding=cp1252"}} encoding.
# Create a Plan which includes characters which vary in encoding. 
# Export this plan. 
# Confirm the plan opens as a UTF-8 Encoded file using a text editor. 
# Import the plan. 
# Observe the characters become corrupt. JIRA Portfolio has treated the file as a 'cp1252 encoded file. 


h3. Expected Results
JIRA Portfolio should treat the file as a UTF-8 file on import and export. 


h3. Actual Results
JIRA Portfolio corrupts some characters, when the system file encoding is not  UTF-8. 
For Example: 
{code}
这是一个例子
{code}

Becomes:
{code}
è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªä¾‹å­
{code}


h3. Workaround
Set the File Encoding to UTF-8 in JIRA. 
This can be done by adding the property {{-Dfile.encoding=utf-8"}}: by following the instructions in: [Setting Properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-120007.html]. 

Note: This will not fix existing corrupted plan templates, that have been previously imported/exported and contain corrupted characters when accessed with a text editor using UTF-8 encoding.
fields.summary: Importing Portfolio Plan treats file encoding as system encoding
Portfolio - Plan export the backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1220].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The current implementation of the permission handling can lead to some confusing scenarios where e.g. plan permissions get bypassed by global permissions.

The interaction of these two permission levels should be redesigned. 



h3. Scenario
#     Create 2 groups - read-only and portfolio-editor.
#     Grant read-only group with Portfolio Viewer permission in Portfolio global permission.
#     Grant portfolio-editor group with Portfolio User permission in Portfolio global permission.
#     Create 2 users - User A and User B.
#     Put User A in read-only and User B in portfolio-editor.
#     Create a Portfolio plan.
#     Configure the plan's permission to give only User B for Viewers.
#     Login with User A and try to access the plan. It is allowing this user to view it regardless of the plan's permission.
#     Add portfolio-editor group to plan's permission Editors.
#     Now, User A will be blocked from accessing the plan.

h3. Expected Behavior
Portfolio should only allow User B to access the plan without the need of setting a group for Editors to enforce the permission.
fields.summary: Rework the plan/global permission handling
Determine dependencies across different plans

h3. Steps to reproduce:

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1125].
  {panel}

I have multiple teams whose skills do not overlap. Each team has a separate JIRA project. Epics are in another JIRA project.

PROJ (Epics)
ATEAM (Stories) 
BTEAM (Stories) 
CTEAM (Stories) 

Currently whenever I want to import issues, I need to do it 4 times: Once for each team, so I can set the skill for the estimates, and before that for the Epics, so that the relationship is retained. It's a pain in the a*** and very error prone.

Also if I want to create and link issues, I have to do it 4 times. Once for each team, and once for the epic. This is another total pain.

Instead what I want is to configure relationships like this:

PROJ <––> No team, but all epics live here
ATEAM <––> "A Team" Portfolio team <––> Skills & Stages for A Team
BTEAM <––> "B Team" Portfolio team <––> Skills & Stages for B Team
CTEAM <––> "C Team" Portfolio team <––> Skills & Stages for C Team

Once that's done, I should be able to:
# Import stuff from JIRA into Portfolio in one go without having to select skills, i.e. without having to duplicate effort and rethink everything every single time.
# Create and link issues in JIRA from Portfolio without having to pick the project etc. It should be able to look at which Team I set on the story and create the issue in the corresponding project in JIRA. It should also know that all Epics go to the PROJ project.

It all comes down to these two principles: Do what reasonable users expect should work! Stop making me repeat myself everywhere!

Certain date formats that are accepted in JIRA as _Date/Month/Year_ format are not accepted by Portfolio's date picker. The problem here was that the year format was specified in upper-case Ys (e.g., dd.MM.YYYY) which is correctly interpreted in JIRA but causes the date picker in Portfolio not to open / accept manually input dates.

*Workaround:*
Change the upper-case _Y_ to lower-case _y_

Original bug report:
bq.As far as I know, this is already known bug, however, I wasn't able to find it. We are not able to choose date from date time picker in any section of JIRA Portfolio. Could you please update us on this bug, is this fixed in some version or we should still wait? Regards, Jelena

fields.description:
When a stage percentage is changed all the other stages are auto-recalculated to force the total percentage to 100%.  This makes it close to impossible to make specific changes to stage percentages.

For example, I have Requirements=10%, Design=10%, Development=50%, and Testing=30%.  I want to add Packaging=10% and change Development to 40%.  When I Create Stage Packaging and set it to 10% it automatically rebalances all of the other stages.  You have to iterate over all of them repeatedly until you finally get them balanced.  Very poor design.

Please refer to various 401k allocation sites as to good design in allocations adding up to 100%.  They generally allow you to make modifications as necessary and then have a Save button that will not let you save if the total is not 100%
fields.summary: Stage Percentage auto-recalculation to 100% makes it close to impossible to modify stages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1045].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
For Kanban Teams, in an epic, there can be a possibility of the *Bottleneck* and *Free Capacities* is showing the same skill. This is caused by the bottleneck and free capacities are calculated on a daily basis and then aggregated weekly. 
 !Screen Shot 2015-11-18 at 10.38.00 am.png|thumbnail! 

*USE CASE*
* In this example, I have an epic that takes 4 days to complete
* I also only have 2 developers
* In the first day, both developers will work on the epic. This means 2 man-days of work will be done on that epic. This leaves 2-man days left
* However, for that first day, there will be a bottleneck as we did not have enough people to complete that epic in one day
* In the second day, both developers will again put in 2 man-days of work. This will complete the epic. So it will no longer be a bottle neck
* For the rest of the days of the week, there will be free capacities

{panel}
So if we list the bottlecks and capacities for the whole week it will look like:
Mon: Bottleneck
Tue: (No bottleneck or free capacity)
Wed: Free Capacity
Thu: Free Capacity
Fri: Free Capacity
When we aggregate/combine this for the whole week we get:
Week 1: Bottleneck and Free Capacity
{panel}

This could lead to confusion to the users

h3. Suggested Solution
* To show more details on the bottle neck & free capacity. Probably provide a 'Details' link beside the bottleneck and provide information on on which day is the bottleneck and free capacity falls.
fields.summary: Bottleneck and Free capacities showing the same skills

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1042].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
According to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Status+and+Progress+Tracking], in the backlog:
{quote}
Completed items show a full green line.
{quote}

This is illustrated below as number 4:
!Progress bars.png|thumbnail!

Also, the issue should count toward the Epic progress as part of the finished progress bar (increasing the bar).

However, this is not happening, at least not in JIRA Portfolio Cloud. When completing the issue and updating the plan, the issue is completely removed from the plan and it stops reflecting in the progress.

h3. Environment
This was reproduced in JIRA Cloud, version: 7.1.0-OD-01-048
The Portfolio version is 1.10.7-OD-001-D20151111T050557 (not available in the 'Affects Version/s field)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create plan with 'Sample data set'
# Create a 'Scrum Software Development' project (a Software project)
# Create and link all issues in one initiative, as instructed below:
#* Hover cursor over the initiative (initiatives page)
#* Click the down arrow that appers
#* Click 'Create and link new issues'
#* Keep all of them selected and select the project created before in 'Create in project'
#* Click 'Create an link issues'
# Log work in a story issue
# Update plan
#* Plan >> Update from date >> enter today >> 'Initiallize'
#* Progress in its Epic will increase
# Move same story issue to 'Done'
# Update plan again

h3. Expected Results
* After moving issue to 'Done', issue continues in the plan
* It's progress is full
* It continues to count toward progress of the Epic

h3. Actual Results
* Story issue is completely removed from board
* The Epic progress won't count (in this case, as this was the only issue with progress, the Epic progress will go down to empty again)
 

h3.Workaround
None so far
fields.summary: Complete story issues are removed from board and stop counting towards progress
Rename JIRA Portfolio to Portfolio for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1039].
  {panel}

At the moment, if we have an estimated epic that has estimated child stories...

- The estimate column displays the sum of children's estimates.
- The progress column displays the sum of the children's estimates, *plus* the estimate that is directly on the epic.

This can be somewhat confusing, so it might be better if the progress column displayed the same value as the estimate column.
fields.summary: Epic estimate summation should be consistent between estimate column and progress column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-971].
  {panel}

GIVEN i am within the Portfolio Add On
AND the Epics and Stories already have a Issue Link and therefore exist in Jira Agile
WHEN i move a Story in Portfolio to another Epic
THEN the Epic Link of that Story within Jira Agile should be updated to the new Epic
ACTUALLY the Epic Link Stays the same in Jira Agile and does not represent the new relationship as set in Portfolio Add On

GIVEN i am within JIRA Agile 
AND i Update the Epic Link of the Story to another Epic which is already known and existing within the Portfolio Backlog
WHEN i update from Date
AND i go to the Portfolio Backlog in order to see if the update was successfull
THEN the new Relationship between Epic and Child Story should be represented and not differ from the relationship within Jira Agile
ACTUALLY it is not updated
fields.summary: Move to Epic (story) does not Update Epic Link in Jira Agile for Story and vice versa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-755].
  {panel}

Hi!
We have issues in Sprint1 in Portfolio http://prntscr.com/8thcvy

Part of them is only partly done http://prntscr.com/8thd7v

When Sprint1 will be finished, all issues that were not completed will be moved to Sprint2 (and some issues from Sprint2 will be pushed out by them to Sprint3 and so on) http://prntscr.com/8thegt

The question is: if the issue have 10 hours estimation and completed 90% in Sprint1 (9 hours is tracked as done) after moving to the next Spint2 (in our case) how much time will it "book" for a given team member (10 hours or 1 hour)?

Could you please help me to understand. Thank you!
fields.summary: issue time progress affect total planned time for a team member

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-543].
  {panel}

We have too many stories and usually these stories are created time by time. We want to mantain on portfolio only epic (and actually this is working) and track progress at story level.
The main problem here is that during "update from date" procedure, the progress is calculated adding time spent connected to epic and remaining estimate.
We want to give the user (portfolio edit permission) the capability to decide how progress is tracked, not only with time tracking but with 2 more setting like:
* sum time tracked
* sum remaining estimate.

this can help solve different situation that we are facind in different project and application of portfolio
fields.summary: Track progress without remaining estimate

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior
A plan should be created successfully on Portfolio regardless of the version of JIRA Agile used or a warning should be triggered suggesting an update to a compatible version of JIRA Agile.

h3. Actual Behavior
The below error appears in JIRA logs when trying to create a plan in JPO and the plan is not created successfully.
{noformat}
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.customfield.ManagedCustomFieldsService.getRankCustomField()Lcom/atlassian/jira/bc/ServiceOutcome;
	at com.atlassian.jpo.agile.api.customfields.AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640.getRank(AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.jpo.agile.api.customfields.AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640.access$300(AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640.java:17)
	at com.atlassian.jpo.agile.api.customfields.AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640$1.perform(AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jpo.agile.api.customfields.AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640$1.perform(AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.jpo.agile.api.service.BundleServiceAccessor.perform(BundleServiceAccessor.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.jpo.agile.api.customfields.AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640.getCustomFields(AgileCustomFieldsServiceBridge640.java:43)
	at com.radiantminds.roadmap.jira.common.components.utils.customfields.CustomFields.getJiraAgileData(CustomFields.java:133)
	at com.radiantminds.roadmap.jira.common.components.extension.issues.data.hierarchy.LuceneHierarchyResult.init(LuceneHierarchyResult.java:93)
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Agile 6.3.13.1 or an earlier version;
# Install JIRA Portfolio version 1.10.5;
# Try to create a plan in JPO;

h3. Workaround
Upgrade JIRA Agile to version 6.4 or later.
fields.summary: Agile versions below 6.4 cause exceptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-533].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, _Originally Planned_ estimation will be synchronized with _Estimate_ in JIRA Portfolio. Thus, when _Estimate_ value gets changed, it will change _Originally Planned_ estimation. This way, user does not have the option to preserve and keep it as the reference.

h5. Suggested Solution
This would be great to have option to preserve the _Originally Planned_ estimation. This way, user has the option to refer back to the initial estimation, perhaps for performance evaluation for the next plan.
fields.summary: Have the option to preserve the Originally Planned estimation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-531].
  {panel}

So I noticed with the following configuration where auto-sync is on and update estimates is on, and progress metric is story points where progress tracking for stories is via time spent and remaining estimate, the following loop happens causing estimates in both JIRA P and linked JIRA Issue to decrease even when no work has been logged.
For this example let's say we have an issue that is 10 story points, The total estimated time is 25 hours, 10 of those hours are for a Subtask
1. log work on a subtask under the issue. (lets say 4 hours)
2. Refresh your Portfolio so that progress is updated
3. Plan> Update From Date. -- Since work has been done on the issue, the estimate is reduced, (i.e. we are now looking at a remaining estimate) which makes sense. We have worked 4 out of the 25 total hours, i.e.16% and so that would be 1.6 out of the 10 original story points, so we now have a remaining estimate of  8.4 story points. Confirm the update
4. Refresh the Issue, you will see that because the estimates are synced, the story points for that issue says 8.4.
5. Plan >Update From Date-- even though no work has been logged on the issue, it is updating the remaining estimate. I.e. the story points say 8.4, you have completed 16% of work on the original estimate, so reduce 8.4 by 16% and now the remaining estimate is 7.056.
6. Refresh the issue, story point estimate is now 7.056
7. Plan > Update From Date-- even though no work has been logged it sees 7.056 and that 16% of the time based estimate is completed so reduces remaining estimate to 5.92
And so on and so forth.

If no work has been logged since the last update, when I do a plan update it should not adjust/suggest this new estimate. Otherwise I have to remember if there has been progress since the last update and then accept/reject the suggested remaining estimate accordingly.
fields.summary: Problem with Update From Date and Auto-sync-- Endless Loop
